{"step_by_step_thinking": "According to the document 'The effect of movement on the holding power of screws in bone', a radiolucent 'halo' about the screw is a certain sign of screw loosening. This suggests that dead bone may appear radiolucent on a radiograph. Additionally, necropsy material from Aseptic necrosis of bone in a compressed air worker shows that although two lesions were juxta-articular, neither had the bone collapsed and histology of only one similar lesion is reported in the literature (McCallum et al. 1966).", "answer_choice": "A"}
